page_004.text: ECONOMIC SURVEY 2022 FOREWORD The Popular Version is based on a master set of data from the 2022 Economic Sur- vey publication that has been compiled by the Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS). It is an easy to read publication with highlights on economic performance and indicators in 2021. The Economic Survey is an annual pub- lication focusing on the socio-economic highlights of the economy for the last fi ve years. The report forms an important source of input into the budgeting, planning, monitoring and policy formulation processes with guidance to national development policy and investment decisions. Finally, it gives an analysis of data collected through Administrative sources supplemented by surveys and censuses. Macdonald George Obudho MBS Director General, KNBS
paragraphs: ECONOMIC SURVEY 2022 FOREWORD The Popular Version is based on a master set of data from the 2022 Economic Sur- vey publication that has been compiled by the Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS). It is an easy to read publication with highlights on economic performance and indicators in 2021. The Economic Survey is an annual pub- lication focusing on the socio-economic highlights of the economy for the last fi ve years. The report forms an important source of input into the budgeting, planning, monitoring and policy formulation processes with guidance to national development policy and investment decisions. Finally, it gives an analysis of data collected through Administrative sources supplemented by surveys and censuses. Macdonald George Obudho MBS Director General, KNBS

page_005.text: ECONOMIC SURVEY 2022 ABOUT KENYA NATIONAL BUREAU OF STATISTICS (KNBS) Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) is established as a State Corporation by an Act of Parliament, the Statistics Act No. 4 of 2006, and its mandate is anchored on the Constitution of Kenya, 2010. The Bureau is the principal agency of the Government for collecting, analyzing and disseminating statistics in Kenya and as the custodian of official statistical information. Vision To be a global leader in the provision of quality statistical services. Mission To provide, manage and promote quality statistical services through utilization of best practices for evidence based decision making. Mandate KNBS is the principal agency of the government for collecting, compiling, ana- lysing, publishing and disseminating statistical information needed for planning and policy formulation. The Bureau is also responsible for co-ordination of the National Statistical System (NSS) in the country. Core Values Professionalism: The Bureau strictly abides by professional considerations, including scientific principles and ethics on methods, standards and procedures for provision of quality statistical services. Integrity: The Bureau adheres to the principles of good governance to ensure trans- parency and accountability in undertaking it’s programmes and activities. Confidentiality: The Bureau treats all information provided by stakeholders with strict confidentiality and use it exclusively for statistical purposes. Customer focus: The Bureau commits itself to align its programmes to the expectations of all stakeholders and attaining the highest standards in service delivery. Innovation: The Bureau continuously embraces creativity and innovation for value-ad- dition in its business processes. Teamwork: The Bureau embraces teamwork in pursuing timely attainment of targeted results at all levels, through coordination and networking. 1 I Popular Version
paragraphs: ECONOMIC SURVEY 2022 ABOUT KENYA NATIONAL BUREAU OF STATISTICS (KNBS) Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) is established as a State Corporation by an Act of Parliament, the Statistics Act No. 4 of 2006, and its mandate is anchored on the Constitution of Kenya, 2010. The Bureau is the principal agency of the Government for collecting, analyzing and disseminating statistics in Kenya and as the custodian of official statistical information. Vision To be a global leader in the provision of quality statistical services. Mission To provide, manage and promote quality statistical services through utilization of best practices for evidence based decision making. Mandate KNBS is the principal agency of the government for collecting, compiling, ana- lysing, publishing and disseminating statistical information needed for planning and policy formulation. The Bureau is also responsible for co-ordination of the National Statistical System (NSS) in the country. Core Values Professionalism: The Bureau strictly abides by professional considerations, including scientific principles and ethics on methods, standards and procedures for provision of quality statistical services. Integrity: The Bureau adheres to the principles of good governance to ensure trans- parency and accountability in undertaking it’s programmes and activities. Confidentiality: The Bureau treats all information provided by stakeholders with strict confidentiality and use it exclusively for statistical purposes. Customer focus: The Bureau commits itself to align its programmes to the expectations of all stakeholders and attaining the highest standards in service delivery. Innovation: The Bureau continuously embraces creativity and innovation for value-ad- dition in its business processes. Teamwork: The Bureau embraces teamwork in pursuing timely attainment of targeted results at all levels, through coordination and networking. 1 I Popular Version

The growth was supported by relaxation of measures put in place to control the spread of COVID-19. Germany 2.9% United Japan Kingdom 1.8% 6.9% United China States of 8.1% Kenya America 7.5% 5.6% Tanzania 4.0% Brazil South 5.0% Africa Uganda 5.2% 4.7% Annual Global inflation rates, 2000-2021 World inflation rose from 3.2% in 2020 to 4.3% in 2021 with the surge attributed to high agricultural and energy prices as well as supply chain disruptions. Global Inflation Kenya's Inflation

page_016.text: ECONOMIC SURVEY 2022 AGRICULTURAL SECTOR Performance of Key Agricultural Products in 2021 The Agricultural sector is estimated to have to have contracted by 0.2% in 2021 amid unfavourable weather conditions in various parts of the country, which resulted in reduced crop and livestock production. Production of selected Agricultural Products, 2017 - 2021 Maize production went down by 12.8% while production of beans decreased by 14.0% in 2021 12 I Popular Version
